Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2009 11:02PM TrustinHim wrote: Hi BabyLemp1 Please try not to be afraid...our fears of the unknown are the worst part sometimes.  I just had my surgical excisional biopsy this past Friday and it was a breeze (thank you God).  They gave me what I guess would be called general anesthesia...I was asleep the entire time...that is what I told them I wanted and they were happy to do that for me.  The procedure only took about 45 minutes or less...and I was only at the surgery center for about 2 to 3 hours total...and 1 hour of that was trying to completely wake me up before I could go home. :o) The incision was only about 1 to 2 inches and was covered with a type of surgical "tape" that disolves so there was no need for stitches.  I had only a tiny wee bit of soreness in the one little spot for about a day...not hardly enough to mention.  I was able to shower and do most activities as normal that night.  They do ask that we do not lift anything over 10 lbs for several weeks....just to be sure we don't mess up the healing process of the incision area.  I was so greatfully surprised at how great this procedure went.  I hope you have smooth sailing also and will be praying for you. If you happen to be in NC, I can give you the name of my surgeon...he was wonderful.
